page.title: 18Movement in the area 1
page.content: With the help of the Vicar of Sway we were able to learn a little as to how the area has changed over the last few decades. Over 80% of the population has moved in over the last 20 years many people moving in from Scotland, the Midlands, London and Yorkshire. Many wealthy people and those due to retire come to this area for health reasons or seeking solitude. Old people rely on neighbours for transport but often the nearest neighbour is a quarter of a mile away.There's a{bus}every 2 hours between Lymington and New Milton coming via the Wheel Inn but this is limited and reportedly unreliable. Many large houses have been turned into flats or nursing homes. Sway Court & Arnewood Court are now flats, the latter built of concrete by Andrew Peterson who also built Sway Tower.
